complaints.description: Local residents are complaining about the constant presence of human and animal feces, used syringes, and accumulating trash along the streets of the 300 block of Hyde Street. We demand prompt action to address these daily hazards.

Citizens on Fillmore Street are outraged by the recurring illegal dumping that leaves hazardous waste and trash scattered throughout the area. We demand stronger enforcement and immediate cleanup efforts.

Residents in Bayview-Hunters Point are distressed by the extremely poor air quality caused by high levels of particulate pollution and industrial emissions. We fear for our health and demand immediate action to reduce these risks.

Citizens in the Tenderloin District are fed up with the massive accumulation of trash—including furniture, bicycles, and hazardous waste—piling up on sidewalks. This chronic problem is a serious public health concern that demands immediate attention.

Residents are upset about the $20,900 price tag on the new 'Soft Square' trash cans with QR codes, especially when litter problems continue unabated. We demand more responsible and cost-effective spending by our city.

Citizens in the neighborhood are complaining about constant illegal dumping at more than 30 identified hotspots, resulting in an annual accumulation of 18,000 tons of street trash. We demand immediate intervention to clean up our community.

Residents in the Tenderloin District are outraged by the persistent contamination of our streets with human and animal feces. Despite weekly steam-cleaning and constant pressure washing, the issue remains unresolved and hazardous.

complaints.location: Mid-Market Neighborhood (1355 Market St, former X HQ)
complaints.description: Local business owners and residents are complaining about the commercial blight in our neighborhood, with vacant retail spaces and abandoned items near the former X headquarters leading to significant economic losses.

Citizens across the metro area are alarmed by dangerous levels of air pollution, with our region ranking poorly for ozone and particle pollution. Over 90% of residents are facing failing air quality grades, and we demand cleaner air now.

Residents are frustrated by the removal of 36,000 lbs of trash every week from homeless encampments, which includes hazardous materials that block sidewalks and contaminate storm drains. We demand more effective solutions to protect our community.

complaints.location: Clement Street near Green Apple Books (6th Ave & Clement St), Richmond District
complaints.description: Citizens in the Richmond District are complaining about illegal dumping on Clement Street, where overflowing trash bags and broken furniture are dumped in front of businesses, causing major accessibility issues.

complaints.location: 300 block of Hyde Street (Hyde & Eddy St), Tenderloin
complaints.description: Residents on the 300 block of Hyde Street are outraged by the continual accumulation of human feces, used syringes, and trash on sidewalks, which has earned the block a notorious reputation as the dirtiest in SF. We demand urgent action to safeguard pedestrians.

Citizens in Bayview-Hunters Point are frustrated by the chronic illegal dumping of construction debris, household waste, and hazardous materials. Despite $1,000 fines for offenders, the problem persists and our community remains at risk.

Residents near the Tenderloin Housing Clinic are upset that non-functional public bins are overflowing and attracting illegal dumping, which in turn creates significant wheelchair access barriers. We demand that our repeated complaints be addressed promptly.

Citizens in Bernal Heights are complaining about residential bin violations where visible garbage bins are being fined despite the lack of alternative storage options. We feel these enforcement actions are unfair and impractical.

complaints.location: Larkin St between O'Farrell St & Golden Gate Ave, Tenderloin
complaints.description: Residents are voicing their anger over the more than 36,000 pounds of trash collected weekly near homeless encampments, which includes hazardous waste and items caught in ownership disputes. This situation is unacceptable and demands immediate resolution.

Citizens are complaining about corporate waste violations at Twitter HQ, where makeshift employee bedrooms and accumulated trash highlight serious zoning and safety concerns. We demand accountability and proper oversight.
New complaint description
Anonymous citizen reports that students are walking on the grass in front of Memorial Church despite clear signage to stay on pathways. This is damaging the historic lawn and landscaping.
Anonymous complaint about students sitting on and walking through the historic Main Quad fountain area. This behavior risks damaging the historic structure.
Anonymous report of students creating shortcuts through the ornamental gardens at Green Library's west entrance, trampling protected plant species.
Anonymous citizen concerned about people sitting and walking on the decorative stonework at the base of Hoover Tower, which could cause wear to the historic structure.
Anonymous complaint regarding students walking across and sitting in the center of the historic Oval park area, despite signs requesting to keep off the grass.
Anonymous complaint regarding uncleaned garbage and mess left in public walking areas.
